reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is decent enough but doesn't hold my attention for more then 30 minutes to an hour. The shooting isn't as crisp and I would like and there is very little variation in enemies.

Has potential but where it's at right now I wouldn't recommend buying for the $5.99 asking price.

For a full video review check out my video below.


http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=692025117
voteText: 8 of 11 people (73%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Gameplay is very simplistic - wave both swords in front of you and you're pretty much guaranteed not to lose.

Graphics aren't particuarly good or varied for even an Early Acccess game. No challenge or 'fun' value to be had makes this game a 'play and forget' experience.

Still, VR is in its infancy and hopefully we'll see some better more interactive titles in the coming months.
voteText: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

An excellent start with promise.

While its 'another zombie game' when we have hordez, zombie simulator, brookhaven experiment, etc, it does well to set itself apart already.

The zombies ragdoll and flop around when you kill them. You unlock better weapons during a round by getting headshots and killing zombies with your katana.

And you can throw said katana, which is extremely fun and amusing.

The dev is also fairly responsive with the community so far, which is a plus.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Buggy as hell. Pistol launches zombies high in the sky, weapon model doesn't replace controller model. However, first is kind of fun and latter can be easily fixed.

The game itself is very simple if not basic. But VR makes it really fun.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAll I can say about this game is...WHAAAAAAAAAA!!!??? If you can tolerate a good workout and love your room scale scenario which I do then for $6 this game is worth every penny. They should not have refunds for VR games. I have seen so many people talk about playing the short games and then putting in for a refund. That is lame imo. This is a full sized arcade zombie shooter in the realm of high impact. I just got done playing....and I am very tired. I can't wait to play it tomorrow. Get it. Play it. And then tell the devs to release a version that has multiple levels and scenarios. There is a lot more potential to this game then what is there. Great fun for family play and party play and solo play.

Product received for free

Early Access Review

OK. It is not bad for the price. BUT
It need to be polished.

(1).In game font and interface is poor
(2).movement of zombies is unnatural
(3).zombies' modeling is poor
(4).physics is poor

Even though above problems
This game is quite fun. and music
Is good.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After playing it for a little while I've deciding to keep it because I want to support any developer that will let me hack zombies into pieces.

Having said that this game needs a lot of work and more varieties in the way enemies attack. I would like to use my roomscale more and the only way to do that is to not have every zombie do a flying lunge at you from the edge of the play Space or have a drunken zombie side step and attack me in my blind spot.

Please slow it down and let me methodically and intelligently eliminate the enemies in fun and creative ways instead of flailing in a million directions.

In summary, I had fun but was also frustrated at the same time. Please keep developing because there is potential here.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is alot of fun. The swordplay feels great and the sound effects of the sword while pulling out of your back and swinging are awesome. Yes you can cheat by swinging the swords infront of you, so just dont do that. I dont touch the guns all too often and spend most of my time throwing the swords like frisbees. My complaint would be that the difficulty ramps up too quickly. If you think of it as an arcade game, it is well worth the money. Hopefully it gets updated and expanded upon.

Early Access Review

Not as bad as it looks.   I mean it looks as bad as it looks, but it's not a complete throwaway like I expected.
As far as unrealistic zombie games go I'd probably pick this over Zombie Training Simulator since it's a bit more over the top.
